name: CARDIOVASCULAR TEST
title: Assess Your Cardiovascular Health
instructions: Answer the following questions based on your heart health symptoms. Score: 1 = Never, 2 = Sometimes, 3 = Frequently, 4 = Often, 5 = Always. Total score at the end of each section will let you know your heart health risks and suggested recommendations immediately.

sections.name: cardiovascular
sections.title: Cardiovascular Health (Heart & Blood Pressure Issues)
sections.description: Tobacco narrows arteries, raises blood pressure, and increases the risk of heart attacks and strokes.

questions.question: Do you have high blood pressure or hypertension?
Have you ever felt chest pain, discomfort, or heart palpitations?
Have you been diagnosed with high cholesterol or blocked arteries?
Do your fingers, toes, or lips sometimes turn bluish (a sign of reduced oxygen levels)?
Have you had a heart attack or stroke before?

resultRules.title: Mild Risk
resultRules.description: Your heart is healthy, but quitting tobacco reduces future risks.
resultRules.cta: Call 9773856664 for a free consultation with the Tobacco Cessation Experts

resultRules.title: Moderate Risk
resultRules.description: You may be developing hypertension or cardiovascular issues. Get a BP Check & Heart Screening at your earliest convenience. Quitting tobacco/smoking is recommended to prevent further damage.

resultRules.title: Severe Risk
resultRules.description: You are at high risk for heart disease or stroke. Seek immediate cardiac consultation and quitting smoking/tobacco is strongly recommended.
